subtitle.Text: There was a little bit of concern on my part before any of this got started that you never know how much liberty you’re going to be given, and how much over-direction you’re going to get, because someone hears it a specific, specific way,

and if you deviate from that at all you’re just going to keep doing the line over and over and over again fifty times until it’s right. So I really wasn’t sure what to expect, but even on the first day getting in there and being able to go through a few of the lines and give them what came to mind,

and seeing how closely I think everyone was on the page about it. So the direction was always really positive, and it was always kind of coming from either additional information that changed the context of what I was reading,

or a certain change in the phrasing or the way something is being, you know, a pause here or maybe move it to here, or instead of emphasizing this word try this one instead. So you end up with a lot of different takes that really give it a very different feeling depending on which one you go for.
